function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"New variant of covid-19 driving increased transmission","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of social distancing measures in virtual programs for smes","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Covid-19 outbreak causing factory shutdowns and reduced production","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges posed by the health crisis","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Pivoting business operations to selling face masks may lead to increased physical interaction and potential spread of contagious diseases","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High uncertainty level due to the ongoing crisis","category":"Misinterpretation of data and results","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of sars-cov-2 and covid-19","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of the virus due to economic instability and behavioral changes leading to cultural and lifestyle changes","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Substantial spread of sars-cov-2 from patients to health-care workers due to ineffective personal protective equipment","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unknown effectiveness of portable air filters in clearing sars-cov-2 in real-world ward settings","category":"Lack of effective medical solutions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 particles in the air of hospital wards","category":"Lack of access to health services","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of other pathogens in the air of hospital wards","category":"Lack of access to health services","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High mobility leading to increased spread of contagious diseases like malaria","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Differences in movement patterns impacting regional spread of contagious diseases","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Intervention in high-mobility areas can substantially reduce disease impact","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Seasonal movement rates increase just before the main malaria transmission season, leading to potential spread of malaria","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial heterogeneities in movement patterns and predicted malaria risk lead to variations in relative rates of infection movements, contributing to malaria spread","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High movement rates drive parasite flows across the region, creating areas that are simultaneously both major sources and sinks of parasites","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Malaria risk mapping and prediction based on spatial covariates, vegetation amounts, and population density","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Human movement contributing to the spread of contagious diseases such as malaria","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High levels of movement within communities can lead to rapid transmission of contagious diseases","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Returning residents and visitors from risk areas can potentially carry infections to their home location or new destination, increasing the risk of disease spread","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"De-identified data on malaria cases","category":"Misinterpretation of data and results","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of geolocated data for mapping malaria risk","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission season data collection","category":"Misinterpretation of data and results","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Integration of movement data with case-based risk maps for namibia creates a dynamic framework for understanding connectivity between malaria risk areas","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Achieving malaria elimination in namibia by 2020 requires a clearly defined strategy to deploy resources effectively","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Targeting aggressive attack measures to source communities and implementing sustainable measures in sink regions is essential for reducing malaria transmission in namibia","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Asymptomatic infections leading to undetected transmission","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mismatch of measures and locations for disease elimination","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient targeted operations for identifying and managing asymptomatic and symptomatic infections","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of capacity to rapidly provide diagnostically confirmed malaria incidence in very low transmission environments","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Discovery of virus with genomic similarity to sars-cov-2 raises concerns about potential for human transmission","category":"Lack of effective medical solutions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in pandemics over the 20th century","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher disease burden in specific subsets of urban populations in the global south","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Family of super spreaders causing second wave of infections","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Superspreading events leading to majority transmission of covid-19","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited contact tracing and isolation may lead to unchecked virus transmission","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Population susceptibility to infection is influenced by biological traits and environmental factors","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Zoonotic diseases originating from wildlife and domestic animals","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conditions in peri-urban areas and highly urbanized centers favoring emergence of infectious diseases","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of familiarity with campus buildings and keys may lead to increased contact and exposure to contagious diseases","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of social distancing in classrooms","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential exposure to communicable diseases","category":"Workplace safety and
